title: Futura Condensed-like typeface--anyone know what this is?
content:
Anyone know what this face is? The “S” and the “C” curves in a bit more than Futura Condensed, but otherwise it’s very close.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [header\_search.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/typophile.com/files/header_search.jpg) | 1.74 KB |

 [‹ New York Design Week](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/typophile.com/node/12382 "Go to previous forum topic") [Anyone seen this one before? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/typophile.com/node/12366 "Go to next forum topic")
author: tomjonesrocks

comments.content: Oh, no, the A crossbar is too hight in Interstate.

’ [Noga](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/www.typografski.de/fontboutique/pages/e_fonts_noga.html)’, by [Heinrich Lischka](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/www.fontboutique.de/)_, may be a nice and close alternate, as well_..

It looks a tad heavier, but Elsner+Flake’s digitisation of [Digi Grotesk N Condensed Semi Bold](http://web.archive.org/web/20071112063413/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=EF.503.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SEARCH&sampleSize=24) comes reasonably close.
